channel.title: A List
channel.description:
A self compiled list of possible ways they detect real world trading.
[ul][*]Does the account giving/receiving gold use, or has ever used, a macro program? [*]If no, are either of the accounts standing friends? [*]Do the accounts ISP/IP Addresses associate with that of a third-world gold farming company? [*]Are there chat logs with conclusive evidence of real-world trading transactions? [*]If no, do either players have any history of real-world trading? [*]If no, do either players associate with friends that relate to the above information? (For example, one of the players have a friend who has extensive real-world trading history - Red flag point) [*]If a player receives a large sum of gold, have either of the players interacted with each other before, or after the initial trade? (I.E Are they friends? Have they given gold before?) [*]If possible, do logs show the amounts of gold traded before the initial trade? *** If a player shows a pattern of giving away gold to other players, this is an obvious red flag. [*]Do/Have either accounts shared an IP address with each other?[/ul]
Feel free to discuss this, and add on if you wish.

item.title: A List
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I’ll just trade the money from one account to another and my reason will be that my brother is quitting RS and decided to give me his wealth.

Read full topic

item.title: A List
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

There is so much to track… You realize they have 400 people against millions of items CONSTANTLY being traded?
Sure, partyhats, santas, masks, and other holiday items may be watched, but u can’t follow gold. What if 1gp is added? Is that gold now completely different?

And I’m sure RWT use different IP’s for transactions CONSTANTLY. They’d get shutdown rather fast if not.

Read full topic

item.title: A List
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

[quote=“Mr Mopar X, post:1, topic:379917”][ul][]Does the account giving/receiving gold use, or has ever used, a macro program?
[]If no, are either of the accounts standing friends?
[]Do the accounts ISP/IP Addresses associate with that of a third-world gold farming company?
[]Are there chat logs with conclusive evidence of real-world trading transactions?
[]If no, do either players have any history of real-world trading?
[]If no, do either players associate with friends that relate to the above information? (For example, one of the players have a friend who has extensive real-world trading history - Red flag point)
[]If a player receives a large sum of gold, have either of the players interacted with each other before, or after the initial trade? (I.E Are they friends? Have they given gold before?)
[]If possible, do logs show the amounts of gold traded before the initial trade? *** If a player shows a pattern of giving away gold to other players, this is an obvious red flag.
[*]Do/Have either accounts shared an IP address with each other?[/ul]

Feel free to discuss this, and add on if you wish.[/quote]
could you just say what this is for? Is this some kind of questionnaire if someone has broken the rules or something?

Read full topic
